About.AboutPatientDescription_para1: FR_This monograph part of the Product Monograph, which is created by the drug manufacturer and has been approved by Health Canada.
About.AboutPatientDescription_para2: FR_The IFP and PMI monographs are intended to be used separately as information for the patient. They contain information, in lay language, that is required by the patient for safe and effective use of the drug. Health care professionals may wish to supplement the advice given within these sections on an individual basis, as necessary.
About.AboutPatientDescription_para3: FR_Although the Canadian Pharmacists Association maintains copyright on this information we grant permission to print and distribute individual files for the purpose of providing information to patients.
About.CPHADescription: FR_The Canadian Pharmacists Association (CPhA) is the national voluntary organization of pharmacists committed to advancing the health and well-being of Canadians through excellence in pharmacist care. CPhA is the trusted source of education, information, tools and resources to support safe and effective medication use and optimal drug therapy outcomes for pharmacists, physicians, nurses and other health care practitioners. CPhA is responsible for developing partnerships with key stakeholders and other health care providers to improve the availability and quality of drug and therapeutic information at a national level, while addressing the challenges of providing optimal drug therapy to Canadians.
About.MyMedsDescription: FR_MyMedsCanada.ca was developed by the Canadian Pharmacists Association to provide Canadian consumers and health care providers with access to current, Canadian drug information.  Information about a drug is found in what is termed an Information for the Patient (IFP) – or Patient Medication Information (PMI) – monograph.  MyMedsCanada.ca enables you to search for, view and print the IFP for hundreds of Canadian drug products.

Contact.ContactDescription: FR_MyMedsCanada.ca is managed and maintained by the Canadian Pharmacists Association (CPhA). For technical support and product feedback contact us by selecting one of the following methods.
Contact.ContactInfo:
FR_Tel.: Toll free 1-800-917-9489, outside of Canada 1-613-523-7877
Email: support@pharmacists.ca Website: Provide comments using the feedback form
Fax: Toll free 1-800-601-1904, outside of Canada 1-613-523-0445
Contact.ContactMethod: FR_Customer Service: Weekdays, 8:30 am to 4:30 pm ET (excluding statutory holidays). Website communications, email and voicemail sent outside the hours of operation will be reviewed the next business day. NOTE: We do not give medical advice, nor do we provide medical or diagnostic services.

Disclaimer.MedicalAdviceContent: FR_THE SITE DOES NOT PROVIDE MEDICAL ADVICE. The content on this site is for education and information purposes only. CPhA makes every effort to keep the content current. It does not warrant the accuracy, completeness or timeliness of the information. For more detailed drug information, please visit the manufacturers’ site. NOTE: Information may be changed or updated without notice. MyMedsCanada.ca may also make improvements and/or changes in the products and/or services described in this information at any time without notice.
Disclaimer.MedicalDisclaimersContent_Para1: FR_The information on this site is for Canadian audiences only. MyMedsCanada.ca is designed to offer you Health Canada-approved information for general educational purposes only, and should always be discussed with your doctor or other qualified health care professional before being acted on. Never disregard any advice given to you by your doctor or other qualified health care professional. Always seek the advice of a doctor or other licensed health care professional regarding any questions you have about your medical condition(s) and treatment(s). This content is not a substitute for medical advice.
Disclaimer.MedicalDisclaimersContent_Para2: FR_Neither CPhA, MyMedsCanada.ca nor the content providers (e.g., manufacturers), make any representation concerning the content when used in any other country. While information on this site has been obtained from sources believed to be reliable, neither we nor the content providers warrant the accuracy of content, or other data of any nature contained on this website. We do not give medical advice, nor do we provide medical or diagnostic services. Neither we nor the content providers guarantee that the content on this website covers all possible uses, directions, precautions, drug interactions, or adverse effects that may be associated with any therapeutic treatment.
Disclaimer.Title: FR_Disclaimer

Faq.ContactAnswers: FR_Yes. Please refer to the Contact Us page.
Faq.ContentUpdated: FR_How often is the content on this site updated?
Faq.ContentUpdatedAnswers: FR_Content is updated weekly. Information for the Patient monographs are added or updated as they become available.
Faq.DifferenceBetweenMyMedsAndCPS: FR_What is the difference between MyMedsCanada.ca and CPS?
Faq.DifferenceBetweenMyMedsAndCPSAnswers: FR_The Compendium of Pharmaceuticals and Specialties (CPS) web app has drug product monographs for health care professionals. MyMedsCanada.ca contains only the part of the product monograph that is intended for patients.
Faq.IFP: FR_What is an Information for the Patient monograph?
Faq.IFPAnswers: FR_The Information for the Patient (IFP) monograph tells people how to use the drug safely and effectively. For more details please see the <a href='/about'>About</a. page.
Faq.IFPMany: FR_Why are there so many medication names listed in an Information for the Patient monograph?
Faq.IFPManyAnswers: FR_Drug manufacturers sometimes group several drug products together in one monograph if there is a lot of information that is the same for multiple drug products.
Faq.IFPQuestions: FR_I have questions about what it says about my medication in the IFP. Who should I talk to?
Faq.IFPQuestionsAnswers: FR_It is strongly recommended that you talk to your doctor or pharmacist if you have any questions about the drugs you’ve been prescribed.
Faq.InformationSource: FR_Where does the medication information come from?
Faq.InformationSourceAnswers: FR_The information is written by the drug manufacturer and is approved by Health Canada. The manufacturer sends it to us to include in MyMedsCanada.ca.
Faq.ManySearch: FR_Why are there so many search results for a drug name?
Faq.ManySearchAnswers: FR_If you are searching for a medicinal ingredient (e.g., acetaminophen), there could be many products that contain that ingredient. If you are searching for a product name (e.g., Tylenol, Advil), the manufacturer may have several variations of the medication (e.g., different formulations, for different conditions, different sizes or strengths, etc.).
Faq.MoreInfo: FR_Where can I get more information on a medication?
Faq.MoreInfoAnswers: FR_If you have any questions about your medication(s), please talk to your doctor, pharmacist or other health care professional.
Faq.NotFoundMedication: FR_Why is a medication not found when I search?
Faq.NotFoundMedicationAnswers:
FR_Drug manufacturers decide whether or not they wish to have their drug monograph included in our content. Therefore, if a monograph is missing, it would be because:
  • The manufacturer has not supplied the product monograph for the drug for inclusion in MyMedsCanada.ca, or;
  • CPhA is currently working on the manufacturer’s product monograph for inclusion in a future MyMedsCanada content update.
Faq.Print: FR_Can I print the IFP for the medication?
Faq.PrintAnswers: FR_Yes, you can print it and keep it handy for reference.
Faq.Search: FR_What can I search for on MyMedsCanada.ca?
Faq.SearchAnswers: FR_You can search for drug information based on a product’s brand name, the medicinal ingredient(s) of the medication, the unique Drug Identification Number (DIN), or the drug manufacturer.
Faq.Title: FR_FAQ
Faq.Track: FR_Why am I being asked if I am a patient or a clinician?
Faq.TrackAnswers: FR_We continually strive to improve the user experience. We track users’ activities on MyMedsCanada.ca to better understand what information people are looking for. Clinicians (health care professionals) may use the site differently than patients. To give each group what you’re looking for, we need to know who you are! Your activities on the site remain anonymous and we do not ask for any personal information.
Faq.WebsiteCreatorAnswers: FR_This site was created and is maintained by the Canadian Pharmacists Association (CPhA).

Feedback.Content_Para1: FR_Use the form below to send us a comment on MyMedsCanada.ca, or to inform us of a problem.   When you have completed the form, click on the Submit button.
Feedback.Content_Para2: FR_Customer Service is available Monday to Friday from 8:30am to 4:30pm EST.   Please note that the Customer Service desk is closed on weekends and statutory holidays.   Requests sent outside the hours of operation will be reviewed the next business day.
Feedback.Content_Para3: FR_Help is also available in our FAQ by clicking on the Help button at the top of the page.
Feedback.Content_Para4: FR_Note: THIS SITE DOES NOT PROVIDE MEDCIAL ADVICE. The content on this site is for education and information purposes only. CPhA makes every effort to keep the content current. It does not warrant the accuracy, completeness or timeliness of the information. For more detailed drug information, please visit the manufacturers’ site. NOTE: Information may be changed or updated without notice. MyMedsCanada.ca may also make improvements and/or changes in the products and/or services described in this information at any time without notice.
Feedback.Title: FR_Feedback

Home.Title: FR_What is Lorem Ipsum?
Home.para: FR_Lorem Ipsum is simply dummy text of the printing and typesetting industry.Lorem Ipsum has been the industry's standard dummy text ever since the 1500s, when an unknown printer took a galley of type and scrambled it to make a type specimen book. It has survived not only five centuries, but also the leap into electronic typesetting, remaining essentially unchanged. It was popularised in the 1960s with the release of Letraset sheets containing Lorem Ipsum passages, and more recently with desktoppublishing software like Aldus PageMaker including versions of Lorem Ipsum.

Policies.ContentUseContent_Para1: FR_CPhA authorizes you to view and print a single copy of the material solely for your personal, noncommercial use. Title to the Content remains with CPhA or its licensors. Any use of the Content not expressly permitted by the Terms and Conditions is a breach of these Terms and Conditions and may violate copyright, trademark, and other laws. Content and features are subject to change or termination without notice in the editorial discretion of CPhA. All rights not expressly granted herein are reserved to CPhA and its licensors
Policies.ContentUseContent_Para2: FR_If you violate any of these Terms and Conditions, your permission to use the Content automatically terminates and you must immediately destroy any copies you have made of any portion of the Content.
Policies.CopyrightContent: FR_All text, data on file, documentation and software contained in this site are the property of the Canadian Pharmacists Association (CPhA) and subject to Canadian copyright and intellectual property laws. Reproduction, adaptation, storage, translation or retransmission of any part without expressed permission is prohibited. Limited excerpts may be used for personal use only, provided our copyright notice appears with the material in each instance.
Policies.PermissionRequestsContent_Para1: FR_To request permission to use CPhA material, complete the Permission Request form (en français) and return it by email to permissions@pharmacists.ca.
Policies.PermissionRequestsContent_Para2: FR_For inquiries on the use of the Permission Request form, email: permissions@pharmacists.ca.
Policies.TrademarksContent: FR_The names "Canadian Pharmacists Association" (CPhA), "Association des pharmaciens du Canada", (APhC), MyMedsCanada, MesMédicamentsCanadiens and its logos are trademarks of the Canadian Pharmacists Association. These marks may not be used without the express written permission of CPhA.
Policies.WhenToAskPermissionContent_Para1: FR_All of CPhA’s content, in print and digital, is protected by copyright law.  If you are using a small amount of CPhA content for research, private study, education, parody, satire, criticism, review or news reporting, and your use is fair (e.g., not for profit), then you do not require permission but you must attribute the source (reference it).
Policies.WhenToAskPermissionContent_Para2: FR_If you are using CPhA content for any other purpose, whether in print or digital, you must ask permission as well as attribute the source. Email us your request at permissions@pharmacists.ca.

Privacy.DateTime: FR_Date and time the IP accessed our site;
Privacy.IP: FR_Internet Protocol (IP) address of the domain or the proxy provided by your Internet Service Provider (ISP);
Privacy.appliesTo: FR_This privacy statment applies only to information collected by this website.
Privacy.collectInfo: FR_MyMedsCanada.ca does not collect personally identifiable information about You when You visit Our website unless otherwise stated or unless You choose to provide this information to Us.
Privacy.cookies: FR_MyMedsCanada.ca uses cookies or similar technologies to analyze trends, administer the website, track users’ movements around the website, and to gather demographic information about our user base as a whole. You can control the use of cookies at the individual browser level, but if you choose to disable cookies, it may limit your use of certain features or functions on our website or service.
Privacy.logFiles: FR_We may collect and store in log files certain information automatically. This information is not shared with anyone beyond Our third-party analytics provider and authorized website support staff, except when required by law enforcement investigation (such as to comply with a judicial proceeding, court order or subpoena), and will be used only as a source of anonymous statistical information in aggregate form. This information may include:
Privacy.soleOwner: FR_MyMedsCanada.ca is the sole owner of the information collected on the MyMedsCanada.ca website. We may use aggregate statistics to help Us make Our site more useful to visitors, such as assessing what information is of most and least interest to visitors, and for other purposes such as determining the site’s technical design specifications and identifying system performance or problem areas. We may combine this automatically collected log information with other information We collect about You. We do this to improve services We offer You, to improve marketing, analytics or site functionality.
Privacy.terms: FR_For the purposes of this privacy policy, the terms "We," "Us," "Our" and "MyMedsCanada.ca" refer to our website "http://www.mymedscanada.ca". The terms "You," “Your” and "end-user" refer to you as a user of this website. This privacy policy applies to www.MyMedsCanada.ca, which is owned and operated by the Canadian Pharmacists Association (CPhA). This privacy policy describes how CPhA collects and uses the personal information you provide on our website.
